page.title: 09Hawkchurch_ its environs
page.content: Hawkchurch is in the county of Devon, quite near the county border with Dorset and is in a designated area of outstanding natural beauty. The highest point in the parish is about 550 feet above sea level and it covers the eastern slopes of the Axe valley. The village is called 'Village of Roses' because about 100 years ago Rev. J. Going paid to have roses planted against the walls of all the main street cottages. The area surrounding the village is mainly pastureland used by farmers. The soil consists of sand and clay known locally as 'Foxmould' and 'Red Scrip'.
